Does anyone ever build really, really tiny shuttles? I've been playing around with the above, and it's pretty fun. Takes one Kerbal to a space station, or Munar orbit. Not really practical, but stylish and recoverable. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

I do that sometimes, except I use them as a interplanetary defense using BD armories ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif). I'll post some pics of it later tomorrow.

I almost didn't post this as I have a few times before. My teeny tiny shuttle:

![2014-12-15_00008.jpg](http://i723.photobucket.com/albums/ww239/majorjim/KSP%20PL%20shuttle/2014-12-15_00008.jpg)

![2014-12-15_00015.jpg](http://i723.photobucket.com/albums/ww239/majorjim/KSP%20PL%20shuttle/2014-12-15_00015.jpg)

![2014-12-15_00018.jpg](http://i723.photobucket.com/albums/ww239/majorjim/KSP%20PL%20shuttle/2014-12-15_00018.jpg)

![2014-12-15_00019.jpg](http://i723.photobucket.com/albums/ww239/majorjim/KSP%20PL%20shuttle/2014-12-15_00019.jpg)

I admit, I never finished the launcher.. But the orbiter glided very well. I may pick this up in future too.
Nice little guy, Majorjim! How do those tiny wheels work as landing gear?
